Title: Honorary doctorate presented to Rarara not fake, says varsity official
Summary: The honorary doctorate awarded to Hausa musician Dauda Kahutu, popularly known as Rarara, by the European-American University has been confirmed as legitimate . The announcement comes after questions were raised over the authenticity of the award .

Title: LCFE lists N23.4b Eko Rice contracts
Summary: Lagos Commodities and Futures Exchange (LCFE) has officially listed Eko Rice Classic Contracts valued at N23.4 billion . LCFE marks a major milestone in the transformation of Nigeria’s agricultural and commodities sectors .

Title: Olubadan coronation: Traffic diversions in Ibadan as Tinubu attends
Summary: Coronation Organising Committee for installing the 44th Olubadan of Ibadanland, Oba Rashidi Ladoja, has announced traffic diversions ahead of the ceremony scheduled for Friday, September 26, 2025, at the Mapo Hall .

Title: Oyo govt seeks bailout, intervention  for UI Dental School
Summary: Acting Governor of Oyo State, Barrister Bayo Lawal, has called for urgent national and international intervention to address the acute shortage of equipment and facilities plaguing Nigeria’s dental education sector .

Title: Actress Mercy Aigbe loses mother
Summary: Mercy Aigbe announced the sad news via her verified Instagram page . The actress posted a picture of a candle, signifying mourning, without sharing further details about her loss .

Title: Army’s director of Public Relations, Lt. Col. Apollonia Anele, visits Vanguard Office in Abuja
Summary: Acting Director of Army Public Relations, Lt. Colonel Apollonia Anele, paid a courtesy visit to Vanguard Newspapers’ Bureau in Abuja . The visit was to strengthen collaboration and working relations between the Nigerian Army and the media .

Title: Malawi president Chakwera concedes election defeat
Summary: Critics accuse Chakwera of mismanagement and indecisiveness . Critics accuse her of failing to tackle corruption and deliver on promises to create jobs .

Title: Markets in Ibadan to close for Olubadan coronation
Summary: Markets across Ibadan will shut down on Friday, September 26, 2025, as traders honour the coronation of the 44th Olubadan . Oba Rasheed Adewolu Ladoja will be crowned as the new ruler of the state .

Title: God won’t forgive you if you work against Tinubu – he gave youths hope – APC Chieftain, Obidike
Summary: Obidike Chukwuebuka said President Bola Ahmed Tinubu has rekindled the hope of Nigerian youths . He said bold appointments, people-oriented policies, and reforms aimed at empowerment, job creation, and national development .

Title: No room for crisis in Warri, peace a necessity for sustainable development — CEPEJ boss
Summary: Ijaw, Itsekiri, and Urhobo ethnic nationalities in Warri Federal Constituency urged to uphold culture of peaceful coexistence . Peace has endured since the end of the Warri crisis over a decade ago .
